title: Direct Export Implementation
problem: Export workflows to NetSuite, Intacct, and Xero were coupled to a shared pipeline, causing cascading failures and making debugging difficult.
action: Refactored into direct export paths per integration with isolated error handling, retry logic, and dedicated logging. Implemented Django Q2 for efficient task queuing.
result: Reduced cross-integration failures, improved error isolation, and cut debugging time significantly. Each integration can now fail independently without affecting others.

title: Observability Infrastructure
problem: Production issues were discovered reactivelyâ€”often by customers reporting sync failures. No centralized view of integration health.
action: Built Grafana dashboards tracking sync success rates, latency, and queue depths. Configured Sentry alerts for error spikes and specific failure patterns across Business Central and Sage 300.
result: Reduced mean time to detection for integration failures. Team can now identify degraded performance before it impacts customers.

title: Cross-System Sync Refactor
problem: Deleted categories and projects in the source system weren't propagating correctly to accounting platforms, causing data inconsistencies.
action: Redesigned sync logic to handle deletion events explicitly. Added reconciliation checks and soft-delete tracking across internal platforms and ERP systems.
result: Eliminated data drift between systems. Customers no longer report orphaned records in their accounting software.
